sense.name: international transactions of commerce
sense.examples: Great efforts have been made to improve foreign trade. This city has always been an important center of trade. Their country has a surplus in the balance of trade.

sense.name: the informal exchange of goods between people
sense.examples: I'll make you a trade of my ham sandwich for your candy bar. Boardwalk for the Electric Company is not a fair trade in the game of Monopoly. The couple stayed in a Paris apartment for two weeks as a trade for their summer home in Maine during that time.

sense.name: a line of work or business
sense.commentary: TRADE[+organization][+industry][+genre][+skilled] Reference to a particular kind of work or workers, usually skilled.
sense.examples: There's good money in the coffee trade. Nobody knows the tourist trade like the Thais. In the trade this sort of computer is called a client-based system.

sense.name: trade wind
sense.commentary: TRADE[+force][+winds][+constant][+blowing][+towards_equator] Steady winds blowing form east to west above and below the equator.
sense.examples: They rode the trade winds going west. You can stay on a single tack for days, once you catch the trades.
